definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: But dealers say the long-term effectiveness of such measures could be limited.
sentences.chinese: 但交易员说，这种措施的长期有效性可能是有限的。

sentences.english: This brings us back to our rogue trader.
sentences.chinese: 让我们回到流氓交易员一事上来。

sentences.english: Day traders may buy and sell stocks hundreds of times each day.
sentences.chinese: 很多日交易员在一周左右的时间赔光了所有钱。

sentences.english: Traders misperceived the possibility of rare events.
sentences.chinese: 交易员们错误地估计了小概率事件的可能性。

sentences.english: This is the logic of the hard-core trader and momentum investor.
sentences.chinese: 这就是中坚交易员和动量投资者的逻辑。

sentences.english: Companies can even record conversations that traders have from their desk phones.
sentences.chinese: 公司甚至可以记录交易员通过办公室座机进行的通话。

sentences.english: 'We want to do this on our own, ' Mr. Michaud, the stock trader, responded.
sentences.chinese: 股票交易员米查德回应道，“我们想自己来。

sentences.english: It is a shift from the mindset of being librarians to that of being daytraders.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个由图书馆管理员向外汇交易员的思维转变。

sentences.english: THANKS to slumping markets, investment banks are shedding many of their highly-paid traders.
sentences.chinese: 由于市场不景气，投资银行辞退了许多高薪交易员。

sentences.english: Traders warned that further advances in the dollar would push down the price of oil.
sentences.chinese: 交易员提醒说，美元进一步走高会力挫石油价格。

sentences.english: He was laid off in the downturn as a bond trader.
sentences.chinese: 他曾是一名债券交易员，在经济衰退时被解雇了。

sentences.english: Most successful traders employ some type of trend-following trading strategy.
sentences.chinese: 大多数成功的交易员都会采用一些趋势追踪交易策略。

sentences.english: The Nzd gained on the comments, which will no doubt have traders cutting their rate expectation.
sentences.chinese: 纽元上涨的评论无疑降低了交易员对利率削减的预期。

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of bankers and traders have lost their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 数以万计的金融从业员及交易员会失去他们的工作。

sentences.english: These traders live in a high-tech version of Plato’s cave.
sentences.chinese: 这些交易员生活在一个高科技版本的柏拉图洞穴中。

definition: Wall Street, New York/by extension, American big business
abbr. for 期貨合約|期货合约[qi1 huo4 he2 yue1], futures contract (finance)
Bloomberg (name)/Michael Bloomberg (1942-), US billionaire businessman, politician and philanthropist
